chunk: is this the real reason Hogan CTI wisty had three right hands so over my 15 years plus coaching
I've had multiple students come to me and tell me the quote about Hogan wishing he had three right hands but I think their interpretation could be a
little misguided often what I hear them explaining is that they're trying to apply this power this
Force to the golf ball with their right hand so he wanted to be able to accelerate his right wrist as hard as he could where I think that might be a
little off I think he was after something slightly different in fact I think it could have been exactly the opposite Hogan was actually trying to
accelerate his right arm which would hold his wrist a little bit more more like this so I'll hit one for you
so when we look at what Hogan demonstrated something along these lines and what he actually did in his his real
motion we see that he actually had tons of wrist angles coming down more than just about anybody it didn't appear that he was he
was not trying to get rid of those angles he was trying to keep accelerating that way he couldn't miss the ball to the left so my
interpretation of Hogan's three right hands was more of a holding of the the momentum of that
club up and back so that it could free freely release out front through the golf ball and not apply that Force too
soon so we can think about this if this is my middle we're not
unloading back here rather we're unloading out here so let me demonstrate one where I
apply those exact principles where I keep the angle intact a little longer and hit that lowlighted Hogan like
fade so just to be clear we're not necessarily trying to prevent the angles from unloading but we want to transport
them so that they stay intact longer we want to feel like we're Towing and slinging the golf club out like a
catapult rather than applying force and powering the club out of the top releasing the angles too soon so a
really good way to feel this and to understand this principle would be to throw your golf club down range if I was going to throw this golf club to my
target I wouldn't want to throw the angles out this way cuz the club would hit the ground back here I
want to throw it out out there so for you to be able to feel this you can grip the club upside down and we're trying to
make the whoosh sound from the club that whoosh I want to make it happen over there
not on this side another really good way to feel this principle is to hit some one-handed
shots with your right hand so if we do this incorrectly and I start to apply a throw from the top where I'm actually
unloading angles trying to apply power back here I promise you will have a very difficult
time hitting good shots and your body reacts funny you saw when I did that my body jumped now if
I relax let the angle stay intact and transport it and sling it out front I can actually hit pretty good shots with
one hand so as you can see that was a pretty good shot and you'll notice that the angle was maintained because I was
swinging the club I wasn't powering it with my three right hands so one important note here to keep in mind is that we are talking about the extension
of the trail wrist not this radial angle so we don't want to feel like we're holding this upward cocking of the wrist
we want to feel like the trail wrist is more in extension like when I throw something or shoot a hoop that's the the thing that keeps this face more or less
in line how we want it so we're focused on feeling that trail wrist extension so let me hit one really slow to just show
you what that angle looks like as it moves through the golf ball so for many of you that actually do have those three right hands throwing it
out of the top perhaps good medicine would be to feel like you're actually leaving the extension in and
accelerating the body and the arm more in sync and not trying to get the angles out so fast so just for fun I'm going to
hit a couple more of those nice low Hogan like fades so thanks for watching I really hope you enjoyed this video and isn't it
interesting how quotes from the past can be interpreted in multiple ways however I think it's more important for us to watch what these Legends did as they
demonstrated and as they actually hit shots so can see what was really going on under the hood and that way we can start to apply the correct principles to
our own swings if you're new to the Channel please hit the Subscribe button give us a thumbs up if you enjoyed the video and come visit us at Milo lines
